Extn : 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) j-5 W 6, Aver-10, ETrav, Tf faorft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn. 29th June 2011 POLICY MATTER Technical (80/2011) (Decision taken in Legal Division File NonalDR&A CellARB (Misc)/2010) Sub: Procedure for referring the decision of DRB to Arbitration: Ref: Policy Circular-Tech.- No.77/2011 dated 25.5.2011 on the above subject: If has been decided that the matter about referring the decisions of Disputes Review Board (DRB) Dispute Review Expert (DRE) to Arbitration may be decided by a three Member Committee before proceeding for Arbitration; The three Members Committee referred to in para 2 (d) of above cited circular shall consist of: Member (T) of the area where project lies, (i) Member (Finance): (iii) Member(Administration) 2 The Committee will examine the matter and recommend whether the decision of DBRIDRE is acceptable on merits; On the basis of the recommendation of the Committee, it will be decided whether matter  needs to be referred further to Arbitration or not. 3  It will be the responsibility of the concerned technical division to submit the matter to the above Committee within the period of limitation (as prescribed in the Policy Circular referred above) s0 that the cases are not barred for approaching for Arbitration; Since the decisions of DRBIDRE have to be appealed against within a prescribed time limit, as provided in the contract agreement for referring to the Arbitration, these meetings should be held in time and decision on these issues should not be delayed on this account; 4 All concerned may please note for information and strict compliance: Leuxoz (M: Chandrashekhar) General Manager (Coord ) To AII CGMs at Hqs.
